intro: Calandrinia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Calandrinia fasciculata is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
